stork.feather.util

Class AggregatorSink

  • java.lang.Object
    • stork.feather.ProxyElement<R>
      • stork.feather.Sink<AnonymousResource>
        • stork.feather.util.AggregatorSink

  • public class AggregatorSink
extends Sink<AnonymousResource>
    A Sink which aggregates multiple, randomly-ordered Slices into a single Slice which it rings a bell with on finalization.

    • Method Detail

      • drain

        public void drain(Relative<Slice> slice)
        Description copied from class: Sink
        Drain a Slice to the endpoint storage system. This method returns as soon as possible, with the actual I/O operation taking place asynchronously.

        If the Slice cannot be drained immeditately due to congestion, pause() should be called, and resume() should be called when the channel is free to transmit data again.

        Specified by:
        drain in class Sink<AnonymousResource>
        Parameters:
        slice - a Slice being drained through the pipeline.

      • finalize

        public void finalize(Relative<AnonymousResource> resource)
        Description copied from class: Sink
        This can be overridden by Sink implementations to finalize the transfer of Slices for a Resource.
        Overrides:
        finalize in class Sink<AnonymousResource>
        Parameters:
        resource - the Resource being finalized.
